intro: Tetrarrhena turfosa, commonly known as the coastal grass or sea grass, is a flowering plant species native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets. It is well adapted to salt spray and wind, making it a hardy species in harsh coastal environments. Tetrarrhena turfosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion.
